case_title: Sardar MUHAMMAD RAFIQUE KHAN vs AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU AND KASHMIR and 2 others
court_name: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondents: AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU AND KASHMIR

facts.initial_order_details: Compulsory retirement of the appellant by Deputy Inspector-General of Police.
facts.appeal_outcome: Order of compulsory retirement quashed and fresh inquiry ordered.
facts.second_inquiry_outcome: Appellant acquitted as complainant resiled from original statement.
facts.impugned_order_details: Period of suspension and compulsory retirement treated as leave without pay.
facts.second_appeal_outcome: Appeal dismissed by Inspector-General of Police.

legal_basis.interpretation: Civil servants cannot be refused salary unless dismissed, removed, or reduced in rank, and charges must be proven.

grounds_of_appeal: Presumption of innocence unless charges are proven.
Impugned orders not warranted by law.
Improper consideration of appeal by Inspector-General of Police.
Violation of terms and conditions of service.

tribunal_findings.respondents_defense: Respondents failed to file objections despite multiple adjournments.
tribunal_findings.tribunal_decision: Impugned orders set aside; appellant's suspension and retirement period treated as duty.
tribunal_findings.emoluments: Appellant entitled to salary after deducting pension received during the period.
